body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney. Madison County, Kentucky native. Son of Squire Turner and Elizabeth Turner. Married Mary B. Everitt Turner on October 25, 1857. Married Henrietta Robertson Turner on December 31, 1857. Father of Mary E. Turner, Ben Turner, Squire Turner, and Charlie Turner. Graduated from Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1840. Graduated from law school at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1842. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment during the Mexican-American War from 1846 to 1848. Attorney in Richmond, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved people in Montgomery County in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Montgomery County from 1861 to 1863.
